description:
**Fix Overview**:

To resolve the winlogon elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-30066), apply the relevant update package for your Windows version:

1. Identify your Windows version from the list below:
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2: KB5039212
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2: KB5039212
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2: KB5039213
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64): KB5039211
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2 (x64 and 32-bit): KB5039211
   - Windows 10 (x64 and 32-bit) for earlier versions: KB5039225

2. Download the corresponding update package from the following links:
   - [KB5039211](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039211)
   - [KB5039212](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039212)
   - [KB5039213](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039213)
   - [KB5039225](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039225)

3. Install the update and restart your device to ensure the changes take effect.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure your system is running one of the affected versions.
- Backup important data before proceeding with the installation.

**Details**:
This update addresses a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability that could allow elevation of privilege. For more specific information regarding the applicability of this fix, refer to the respective KB articles for your version.
